title: 從香港給環保少女Greta Thunberg的信

replies.msg:
要connect 環保少女，借用佢光環，莫過於叫佢關注香港環境
現抛磚寫篇文，方便twiiter或其他方式送比佢。

Dear Ms Thunberg,

We are a group of environmentalists from Hong Kong.

First of all, congratulations for being named TIME’s 2019 Person of the Year.

Your passionate speeches on global warming have inspired many of us in Asia.

We are furious because those who are in power and have influence fail to respond to this human made crisis, which could cause irreversible harm to both our planet and our species.

That said, because of efforts by you and others, the world has started to react, albeit slowly.

The situation in Hong Kong is dire, though, and would benefit from your support.

We are now facing another environmental crisis here. Our city has been heavily polluted by tear gas.

You may have noticed from news reports that since protests started in June, the police have used more than 10,000 canisters of tear gas in this densely populated city.

This poses a huge public health danger.

In the short run, those on the frontline, including journalists, bear a huge risk of developing respiratory diseases. As the police fire the canisters indiscriminately, innocent passers-by and even babies have been attacked.

In the long run, the city is polluted. The water system may have been contaminated. There are also talks of carcinogenic dioxins, which have a half-life of many years, may have accumulated in different parts of the city.

Needless to say, the government has refused to conduct an independent inquiry into the issue, and publicise relevant safety data. Even the environmental bureau does not reveal the composition of those canisters. We don’t even know what we are inhaling every day.

Similar to global warming, this crisis is human made and arises from irresponsibility of those in power. The difference is that we are already suffering now, rather than a few decades later. This is therefore an even more immediate issue to us living here.

In this regard, we appeal for your support for Hong Kong. Your moral authority on the issue of environmental issues would assist us in ensuring that we and our descendants can live in a environmentally decent environment.

Any form of support is welcome. You may speak on the issue in international forums, urge international bodies such as the World Health Organisation to study this public health crisis, and even visit us in person. Should you express your interest, we are sure many of us in Hong Kong would line up to help.

May we hope that we all live in an environmentally friendly world where those in power are held responsible for their crimes and those who work hard are entitled to a clean and sustainable world to live in.

Best regards,
Hong Kong citizens
